symptoms.name: Vaginal discharge
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Can be present or absent; if present, may be intermittent or persistent

symptoms.name: Vaginal irritation
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Can be present or absent; if present, may be intermittent or persistent

symptoms.name: Urethral burning or itching
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: More common in men; can be present or absent; if present, may be intermittent or persistent

symptoms.name: No symptoms
symptoms.pattern: Most common presentation, especially in men

physical_findings: Red blotches on the vaginal wall or cervix (in women)
Inflammation or infection-causing germs in vaginal fluids (in women)

lab_values.Nucleic acid amplification tests (NAATs): Detection of T. vaginalis DNA or RNA

risk_factors: Sexual contact with an infected partner

required: Microscopic examination of vaginal discharge showing T. vaginalis (in women)
supportive: Diagnosis of trichomoniasis in sexual partner
